text: <@U11MANG9G> Is there a recommended gerrit plugin to require a jira link and to automatically add the comment to jira for back reference?
<@U1BC5A0F9|elli> has joined the channel
<@U0S5KF44D> I’m not aware of one, but I can check how we can better add it to the workflow.
p.s. Thanks for updating your gerrits this morning! I’ll spend some time reviewing today, so that we can stuff in.
Thanks ... here are some links as possibilities:
<https://github.com/hobbs/jirret>

attachments.title: hobbs/jirret
attachments.text: jirret - Gerrit hooks to update JIRA

text: <https://gerrit-review.googlesource.com/#/admin/projects/plugins/its-jira>
<@U0UHG4VP1> ^^^ (thoughts welcome)
<@U0UHG4VP1|ry> has joined the channel
I know we have other projects that use its-jira, so that would be easiest to sell
Is it a lot of work?
it isn't a ton of work but there would be a little downtime
I will scope that out and see when a good window is to do it - we're all still dealing with Dirty COW mitigation
I would hope this weekend. I'll let you know if it will be later
Yes, that would be best. I don’t want you to over-commit! We can still enforce it `manually`for now...
(so it’s not a life-or-death situation)… but thanks!
Partial implementation of FAB-266 (<https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-266>) is checked-in <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/2049/>
will tag along remaining part soon.
<@U221LL03Z> taking a look right now.
it gives you an overview of what I am doing.
thanks for doing that.
